An Insight Into Highly ... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdjc9jnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdjc9jnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdjc9jnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdjc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdjc9jnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/MITREATTACK">MITRE ATT&amp;CK</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">From ATT&amp;CKcon 3.0

By Jonny Johnson, Red Canary and Olaf Hartong, FalconForce

As defenders, we often find ourselves wanting &quot;more&quot; data. But why? Will this new data provide a lot of value or is it for a very niche circumstance? How many attacks does it apply to? Are we leveraging previous data sources to their full capability? Within this talk, Olaf and Jonny will walk through different data sources they leverage more than most when analyzing data within environments, why they do, and what these data sources do and can provide in terms of value to a defender.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1jc9jnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1jc9jnf6"></div><div threat environment, adversaries are constantly profiling and attacking your corporate infrastructure to access and collect your intellectual property, proprietary data, and trade secrets. Now, more than ever, Threat Intelligence is increasingly important for organizations who want to proactively defend against advanced threat actors.

While many organizations today are collecting massive amount of threat intelligence, are they able to translate the information into an effective defense strategy?

View the slides now to learn about threat intelligence for operational purposes, including real-world demonstrations of how to consume intelligence and integrate it with existing security infrastructure.

Learn how to prioritize response by differentiating between commodity and targeted attacks and develop a defense that responds to specific methods used by advanced attackers.</span></div></div><div The webinar then discusses how adversaries like China and various state-sponsored and criminal groups are adapting their tactics to evade detection, and how security teams must also adapt detection methods to focus on real-time monitoring rather than indicators of compromise. It notes that the mining industry, like other industries, is increasingly relying on integrated and automated systems, leaving it vulnerable to cyber attacks. The mining industry deals with targeted cyber espionage campaigns and disruptive attacks aimed at exploiting its strategic role in global supply chains. The document provides an overview of modern mining operations and infrastructure, noting their complexity and geographical distribution, before examining specific cybersecurity issues and threats.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R14cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R14cajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-4" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R15cajnf6:" popovertarget=":R15cajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R15cajnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/FrankBackes/cybersecurity-a-community-approach-20151109"><span class="sr-only">Cybersecurity A Community Approach - 20151109</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Cybersecurity A Community Approach - 20151109 for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd5cajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd5cajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd5cajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd5cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd5cajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/FrankBackes">Frank Backes</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document proposes that Colorado Springs becomes the &quot;Cybersecurity Capital of the World&quot; due to existing cybersecurity organizations and expertise in the region. It identifies several military and academic institutions in Colorado Springs related to cybersecurity and divides the cybersecurity market into five submarkets - consumer/small business, business/enterprise, industrial, military/intelligence, and ethical offensive cyber. The document argues that understanding these submarkets is important for suppliers to tailor their strategies and that Colorado Springs is well-positioned to bring together resources across sectors to strengthen its position in the cybersecurity field.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R15cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R15cajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-5" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R16cajnf6:" popovertarget=":R16cajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R16cajnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/dave-mahon-centurylink-cyber-security-how-modern-cyber-attacks-are-disrupting-businesses-like-yours/52102723"><span class="sr-only">Dave Mahon - CenturyLink &amp; slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Bear Hunting: History and Attribution of Russian Intelligence Operations</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Bear Hunting: History and Attribution of Russian Intelligence Operations for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd9cajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd9cajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd9cajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd9cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd9cajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Learn about the history of Russian intelligence influence operations and the cyber actors implementing them today.

In June 2016, CrowdStrike exposed unprecedented efforts by Russian intelligence services to interfere in the U.S. election via the hacking and subsequent leaking of information from political organizations and individuals. Election manipulation was not a new activity for the Russians - they have engaged in these influence operations consistently for the better part of the last two decades inside and outside of Russia.

In this CrowdCast, CrowdStrike experts Adam Meyers, VP of Intelligence, and Dmitri Alperovitch, Co-Founder &amp; CTO, will provide a detailed overview of the history of Russian intelligence influence operations going back decades and provide a deep dive overview of various BEAR (including FANCY BEAR AND COZY BEAR) intrusion sets and their tactics, techniques and procedures (TTPs). They will also discuss the considerable attribution evidence that CrowdStrike has collected from a variety of investigations into their operations and lay out the case for the Russian government connection to these hacks.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R19cajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R19cajnf6"></div><div class="separator class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">SOCRadar 2024 Canada Threat Landscape Report</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save SOCRadar 2024 Canada Threat Landscape Report for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdacajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdacajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdacajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdacajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdacajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/socradar">SOCRadar</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Canada’s cybersecurity risks are escalating, with finance and insurance industries making up 12.66% of dark web targets. Ransomware attacks continue to threaten the manufacturing sector, representing 21.11% of cases. LockBit leads the ransomware groups, responsible for 30.3% of attacks. Additionally, stealer logs expose over 208,000 email-password combinations, putting critical systems and sensitive data at risk.

Phishing threats have surged, with cryptocurrency-related attacks comprising 31.66% of incidents. Meanwhile, Canada faced over 110,000 DDoS attacks, signaling the urgent need for organizations to bolster defenses. Threat actors are increasingly leveraging stolen credentials and targeting vulnerable industries.

SOCRadar’s proactive threat intelligence solutions empower Canadian organizations to stay ahead of evolving cyber threats. Detect dark web activities, mitigate ransomware risks, and safeguard your assets with real-time monitoring. Download the full CISO brief now to secure your organization’s future.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1acajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" Continuity and Resiliency for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdbcajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdbcajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdbcajnf6"><span class="icon class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdbcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdbcajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/lkcyber">lkcyber</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">RSA Quick Look Webcast: http://www.rsaconference.com/media/quick-look-proactive-counterespionage-as-a-part-of-business-continuity-and-resiliency

This white paper corresponds to the RSA Presentation entitled: &quot;Proactive Counterespionage as a Part of Business Continuity and Resiliency&quot;
Presentation Abstract: The session will discuss means in which information assets and business continuity is protected and propose an additional layer of defense with a human counterespionage focus. The proposed proactive counterespionage plan includes operational security audits, reverse open source intelligence and classification of employees who are prime targets for disruptive espionage. - See more at: http://www.rsaconference.com/events/ad15/agenda/sessions/2219/proactive-counterespionage-as-a-part-of-business#sthash.DTYlHe6a.dpuf</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1bcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1bcajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-11" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1ccajnf6:" popovertarget=":R1ccajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1ccajnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/common-good-digital-framework-204737401/204737401"><span class="sr-only">COMMON GOOD DIGITAL FRAMEWORK</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:11" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">COMMON GOOD DIGITAL FRAMEWORK</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save COMMON GOOD DIGITAL FRAMEWORK for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdccajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdccajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdccajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdccajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdccajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/bostonglobalforum">Boston Global Forum</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The Common Good Digital Framework (CGDF) is a proposed campaign and platform to monitor violations of ethical values and standards related to artificial intelligence, personal data, cyber security, and digital activity by governments and large organizations. The CGDF will focus on issues like AI bias, privacy, and cyber security, and will generate policy recommendations in response to identified problems. It will utilize partners, advisors, and social media to distribute its findings and recommendations in order to influence policymaking and encourage corrective actions. The goal is to establish new ethical norms and regulations to help guide digital progress for the benefit of all humanity.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1ccajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1ccajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="similarTo-card-description-12" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1dcajnf6:" popovertarget=":R1dcajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1dcajnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/2019-11-terpbreuerdisclosuremaster/191139894"><span class="sr-only">2019 11 terp_breuer_disclosure_master</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:12" terp_breuer_disclosure_master</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save 2019 11 terp_breuer_disclosure_master for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbddcajnf6:" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbddcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbddcajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/bodaceacat">bodaceacat</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses the evolution of misinformation and proposes a framework called AMITT (Attribution, Mitigation, Incident and Technique Taxonomy) to analyze misinformation campaigns and incidents. It suggests populating the AMITT framework by cataloging historical misinformation examples. Finally, it notes that further work is needed to develop mitigations and counters, refine techniques, and share intelligence using the framework.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1dcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1dcajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" Barrett</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This overview is not intended to be a business case for data science. It is expected that you are already familiar with the value proposition. However, a reference to several case study examples has been included at the end of this document as a reminder of the broad applicability of the subject at hand.

The intent of this document is to set in motion the discussion for the creation of a startup in South Africa that is focused on data science.  </span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1ecajnf6:" data-cy="slideshow-title">SOCRadar-Australia-Threat Landscape-Report-2024.pdf</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save SOCRadar-Australia-Threat Landscape-Report-2024.pdf for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdfcajnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdfcajnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdfcajnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdfcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdfcajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/socradar">SOCRadar</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The 2024 Australia Threat Landscape Report by SOCRadar dives into the evolving cyber threats impacting Australia&#x27;s key industries, focusing on ransomware, phishing, and Dark Web activities. Key findings include:

Ransomware Surge: A substantial increase in ransomware incidents, especially from groups like Medusa, LockBit 3.0, and Akira, targeting sectors such as retail and healthcare.
Dark Web Exposure: Australian organizations are heavily featured in Dark Web data sales, with notable activity against the retail and finance sectors.
Phishing and DDoS Attacks: The rise in phishing attacks and record-breaking DDoS incidents underscores the sophistication of current cyber threats.
The report offers strategic recommendations for organizations to enhance cybersecurity resilience, leveraging SOCRadar’s Extended Threat Intelligence, which includes tools for proactive threat detection, Dark Web monitoring, and brand protection.

Get insights from the full report to safeguard your assets and strengthen cyber defenses in Australia’s challenging digital landscape.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1fcajnf6:" popover="auto" Key findings include:

Ransomware Surge: A substantial increase in ransomware incidents, especially from groups like Medusa, LockBit 3.0, and Akira, targeting sectors such as retail and healthcare.
Dark Web Exposure: Australian organizations are heavily featured in Dark Web data sales, with notable activity against the retail and finance sectors.
Phishing and DDoS Attacks: The rise in phishing attacks and record-breaking DDoS incidents underscores the sophistication of current cyber threats.

class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdhcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdhcajnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/cgarcia045">Cristian Garcia G.</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes John Kindervag&#x27;s report &quot;No More Chewy Centers: The Zero Trust Model Of Information Security&quot;. The report argues that traditional perimeter-based network security models are ineffective against modern threats like targeted attacks and malicious insiders. It introduces the &quot;Zero Trust&quot; model, which considers all network traffic untrusted and requires strict access controls and monitoring. The report recommends security professionals adopt this new model to better protect their organizations from sophisticated adversaries inside and outside the network.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1hcajnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1hcajnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/mok">Charles Mok</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses emerging security issues related to fake news, AI, and privacy. It summarizes recent regulations on facial recognition in the US, UK, and EU. It also discusses misinformation campaigns related to protests in Hong Kong and how Twitter and Facebook have taken actions to suspend accounts spreading misinformation. The document explores how misinformation can be spread through deepfake videos and AI-generated fake news. It discusses efforts to combat fake news through fact checking and provides examples from Hong Kong and Taiwan. Finally, it calls for the IT industry to adopt an approach that puts people first, develops privacy-enabled technologies, and promotes openness and public awareness.</span></div></div><div class="" slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">State of Endpoint Security: The Buyers Mindset</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save State of Endpoint Security: The Buyers Mindset for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd1cbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd1cbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd1cbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd1cbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd1cbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Where is endpoint security headed? How do your priorities and capabilities compare to those of your peers?

As the battle against breaches rages on, many enterprises are focused on revamping their endpoint security strategy – from enhancing efficacy to reducing complexity and agent bloat. A new webcast, “State of the Endpoint: The Buyer Mindset,” discusses the current state of endpoint security and offers insights from an all-star panel of thought leaders, including Internationally recognized cybersecurity leader and CrowdStrike Co-founder Dmitri Alperovitch, VP of Product Marketing Dan Larson, and other experts as they discuss today’s most important security issues. Join them as they explore the findings from a new research report, “Trends in Endpoint Security: A State of Constant Change,” a study conducted by ESG and commissioned by CrowdStrike and other technology vendors. The panel will provide their impressions of the data in the survey and how the viewpoints revealed mesh with current technology trends, offering insights that can help inform your security strategy going forward.

Join this webcast to learn:

-The current state of Antivirus (AV) including how many organizations are choosing to change vendors and why
-Best of breed vs. comprehensive suites – which approach do your peers prefer and what are the advantages and challenges of each?
-How solutions are affecting endpoints and your IT Security peers, including the increase in agents installed and the impact of increased complexity</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R11cbjnf6:" RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">How adversaries use fileless attacks to evade your security and what you can do about it

Standard security solutions have continued to improve in their ability to detect and block malware and cyberattacks. This has forced cybercriminals to employ stealthier methods of evading legacy security to achieve success, including launching fileless attacks, where no executable file is written to disk. Download this presentation provided by CrowdStrike security experts to learn why so many of today’s adversaries are abandoning yesterday’s malware and relying on an evolving array of fileless exploits. 

You’ll learn how fileless attacks are conceived and executed and why they are successfully evading the standard security measures employed by most organizations. You’ll also receive guidance on the best practices for defending your organization against these stealthy, damaging attacks.

The following presentation includes:
--How a fileless attack is executed — see how an end-to-end attack unfolds
--Why fileless attacks are having so much success evading legacy security solutions
--How you can protect your organization from being victimized by a fileless attack, including the security technologies and policies that are most effective</span></div></div><div class="" The criminal act of theft is as old as civilization itself, but in the cyber realm new ways to steal your organization&#x27;s data or profit by holding it hostage, continue to evolve. With each advancement in security technology, adversaries work tirelessly on new techniques to bypass your defenses. This webcast, &quot;Cyber Extortion: Digital Shakedowns and How to Stop Them&quot; examines the evolution of cyber extortion techniques, including the latest &quot;datanapping&quot; exploits. Whether it&#x27;s an attack on a major movie studio, a massive healthcare system, or a global entertainment platform, recent extortion attempts demonstrate how critical it is to understand today&#x27;s threat landscape so you can ensure that your organization mounts the best defense possible.

Download this presentation to learn what security experts from the cyber defense frontlines are discussing. Learn about:

•The range of extortion techniques being used today, including commonalities and differences in approaches
•Commodity type ransomware/datanapping vs. hands-on attacks — how are they alike and what are their differences?
•Potential outcomes of paying vs. not paying when attempting to recover data after an attack
•Real world examples of successful attacks and those that were thwarted or mitigated
•Strategies for keeping your organization from being targeted and what to do if you become the victim of a cyber shakedown</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R13cbjnf6:" popover="auto" OverWatch Experts Hunt 24/7 To Stop Incidents Before They Become Breaches

Is your IT security team suffering from alert fatigue? For many organizations, chasing down every security alert can tax an already overburdened IT department, often resulting in a breach that might have been avoided. Adding to this challenge is an increase in sophisticated threats that strike so fast and frequently, traditional methods of investigation and response can’t offer adequate protection. 

A new webcast from CrowdStrike, “Proactive Threat Hunting: Game-Changing Endpoint Protection Above and Beyond Alerting,” discusses why so many organizations are vulnerable to unseen threats and alert fatigue, and why having an approach that is both reactive and proactive is key. You’ll also learn about Falcon OverWatch™, CrowdStrike’s proactive threat hunting service that investigates and responds to threats immediately, dramatically increasing your ability to react before a damaging breach occurs.

Download the webcast slides to learn:

--How constantly reacting to alerts prevents you from getting ahead of the potentially damaging threats designed to bypass standard endpoint security
--Why an approach that includes  proactive threat hunting, sometimes called Managed Detection and Response, is key to increasing protection against new and advanced threats   
--How CrowdStrike Falcon OverWatch can provide 24/7 managed threat hunting, augmenting your security efforts with a team of cyber intrusion detection analysts and investigators who proactively identify and prioritize incidents before they become damaging breaches

href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Learn how to prevent &amp; detect even the most complex “file-less” ransomware exploits

Ransomware continues to evolve as perpetrators develop new exploits with consequences that can be dramatic and immediate. The purveyors of ransomware continue to prosper with adversaries developing new strains such as Zepto and Cerber that are proving to be more challenging than ever. Other exploits can alter programmable logic controller (PLC) parameters and adversely impact mechanical systems. Clearly, new defense approaches are needed because organizations can no longer rely on backups and conventional security solutions to protect them. Join CrowdStrike Senior Security Architect Dan Brown as he offers details on these sophisticated new ransomware threats, and reveals recent innovations designed to offer better protection – including new indicator of attack (IOA) behavioral analysis methodologies that can detect and prevent even the most complex “file-less” ransomware exploits.

Attend this CrowdCast where Dan will discuss:
--The challenges of defending against dangerous new variants, such as Zepto and Cerber
--Real-world examples of ransomware in action and the sophisticated tactics being used by a variety of adversaries
--How the CrowdStrike Falcon cloud-delivered platform can defend your organization against new super strains of ransomware that use sophisticated malware-free tactics

slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">How to Replace Your Legacy Antivirus Solution with CrowdStrike</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save How to Replace Your Legacy Antivirus Solution with CrowdStrike for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd7cbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd7cbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd7cbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd7cbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd7cbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes CrowdStrike&#x27;s endpoint security product Falcon and argues that it provides more effective protection than legacy antivirus solutions. It notes that antivirus has an efficacy rate of only 45% against modern threats and is ineffective at stopping sophisticated attacks. CrowdStrike&#x27;s Falcon uses techniques like machine learning, IOAs, and threat intelligence to prevent a wider range of attacks while having a smaller system footprint than antivirus. It also provides detection capabilities like endpoint detection and response to eliminate attack dwell time. The document aims to convince readers to replace their legacy antivirus with CrowdStrike&#x27;s Falcon.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R17cbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R17cbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" Detection</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:7" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">You Can&#x27;t Stop The Breach Without Prevention And Detection</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save You Can&#x27;t Stop The Breach Without Prevention And Detection for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd8cbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd8cbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd8cbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd8cbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd8cbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses the need for a balanced approach to endpoint security that includes both prevention and detection. It argues that relying solely on prevention is not sufficient, as attacks will always get through, requiring detection capabilities to identify breaches. Likewise, detection alone is insufficient, as preventing attacks upfront reduces workload. The document outlines the key components needed to properly unify next-generation antivirus and endpoint detection and response, including complete visibility of endpoint activity, large-scale analysis capacity, and the ability to derive insights and indicators of attack from collected data. An integrated approach is advocated that allows prevention and detection to strengthen one another.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R18cbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R18cbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document discusses how machine learning can be used to battle unknown malware. It provides examples of using machine learning techniques like feature selection, dimensionality reduction, and classification on military personnel data and malware samples. While machine learning is effective against most malware, it is not enough on its own as many attacks do not use malware. A comprehensive prevention approach is needed to address the full spectrum of threats.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R19cbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R19cbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-9" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1acbjnf6:" popovertarget=":R1acbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1acbjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike/java-journal-pyresso-a-pythonbased-framework-for-debugging-java"><span class="sr-only">Java Journal &amp; Pyresso: A Python-Based Framework for Debugging Java</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:9" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Java Journal &amp; Pyresso: A Python-Based Framework for Debugging Java</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Java Journal &amp; Pyresso: A Python-Based Framework for Debugging Java for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdacbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdacbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdacbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdacbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdacbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Despite the multitude of Java decompilers available, we often have the need to debug or trace malicious or obfuscated Java bytecode. Existing Java debuggers and tracers are mostly targeted towards Java developers, are closed-source, and are not meant to handle malicious or obfuscated targets. We present a new open-source cross-platform framework for debugging Java, written completely in Python, designed specifically for reverse engineering. We also present a Java method call tracer as a sample Python application that utilizes this framework.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1acbjnf6:" popover="auto" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-12" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1dcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":R1dcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1dcbjnf6"><a href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-cast-monthly-mitigating-pass-the-hash/26618483"><span class="sr-only">CrowdCasts Monthly: Mitigating Pass the Hash</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:12" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">CrowdCasts Monthly: Mitigating Pass the Hash</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save CrowdCasts Monthly: Mitigating Pass the Hash for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbddcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbddcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbddcbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbddcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbddcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Sixteen years later and Pass the Hash (PtH) is still one of the most common techniques a targeted attacker can use to compromise a network. There have been many blogs, webinars, and papers covering different PtH mitigation strategies. With all the information about this particular security vulnerability, networks are still continuously attacked and infiltrated using this technique. It is time to look at the problem from a holistic approach and apply the communities&#x27; collective intelligence to make this process one of the most difficult for a targeted attacker to use. </span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1dcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1dcbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-13" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1ecbjnf6:" popovertarget=":R1ecbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1ecbjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/endtoend-analysis-of-a-domain-generating/25244628"><span class="sr-only">End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:13" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/end-to-endanalysisofadomaingeneratingalgorithmmalwarefamily-slides-130814103104-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/end-to-endanalysisofadomaingeneratingalgorithmmalwarefamily-slides-130814103104-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdecbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdecbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdecbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdecbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdecbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document summarizes the analysis of a domain generating algorithm (DGA) malware family. Key points include:

- The malware uses inline code obfuscation and encrypted strings to hide its functionality and communication domains. Researchers were able to deobfuscate the code and decrypt the strings to analyze the malware. 

- Clues in decrypted strings suggest the malware author is Romani, including references to Romani singers in template strings. 

- The malware generates domain names by concatenating two randomly selected words from a dictionary and appending &quot;.net&quot;. This allows it to generate many domain variations to communicate with its command and control servers.

- The DGA algorithm uses a 15-bit seed value derived from the</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1ecbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1ecbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-14" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1fcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":R1fcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1fcbjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/tor-all-the-things/25244568"><span class="sr-only">TOR... ALL THE THINGS</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:14" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="TOR... ALL THE THINGS" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tor-130814102922-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="TOR... ALL THE THINGS" src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tor-130814102922-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">TOR... ALL THE THINGS</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save TOR... ALL THE THINGS for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdfcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdfcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdfcbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdfcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdfcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The global Tor network and its routing protocols provide an excellent framework for online anonymity. However, the selection of Tor-friendly software for Windows is sub-par at best. 

Want to anonymously browse the web? You’re stuck with Firefox, and don’t even think about trying to anonymously use Flash. Want to dynamically analyze malware without letting the C2 server know your home IP address? You’re outta luck. Want to anonymously use any program that doesn’t natively support SOCKS or HTTP proxying? Not gonna happen. 

While some solutions currently exist for generically rerouting traffic through Tor, these solutions either don’t support Windows, or can be circumvented by malware, or require an additional network gateway device. 

Missed the live session at Black Hat USA 2013? Check out the slides from Jason Geffner&#x27;s standing room only presentation! Jason released a free new CrowdStrike community tool to securely, anonymously, and transparently route all TCP/IP and DNS traffic through Tor, regardless of the client software, and without relying on VPNs or additional hardware or virtual machines.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1fcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1fcbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-15" aria-haspopup="dialog" Malware Family Whitepaper</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:15" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdgcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdgcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document provides an overview of domain generating algorithms (DGAs) used by malware to dynamically determine remote server addresses and evade detection. It details the analysis performed on a malware family submitted to CrowdStrike, including deobfuscating the binary, analyzing its DGA and network functionality, sinkholing domains, and investigating the malware author. The family has been active for at least six years and infects thousands of devices.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1gcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1gcbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-16" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1hcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":R1hcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1hcbjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/tor-all-the-things-whitepaper/25207431"><span class="sr-only">TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:16" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save TOR... ALL THE THINGS Whitepaper for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdhcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdhcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdhcbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdhcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdhcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document introduces Tortilla, software designed to allow security researchers to safely and anonymously interact with hostile servers and actors online. It discusses how traditional malware research was more passive, but now requires actively monitoring adversary infrastructure. The Tor network and Tor Browser Bundle are described as existing solutions for anonymity, but they have limitations like only supporting the Firefox browser and not plugins. Tortilla aims to address these issues by providing a more robust anonymity solution.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1hcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1hcbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div Presence of Bootkits</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:17" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save I/O, You Own: Regaining Control of Your Disk in the Presence of Bootkits for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdicbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdicbjnf6:" class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdicbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdicbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This document discusses a technique for regaining control of a disk in the presence of a bootkit by leveraging the crash dump stack in Windows. It provides background on the crash dump stack and how it differs from the normal I/O path. It then describes how identifying and calling the crash dump port and miniport drivers allows sending I/O requests outside of the normal path to bypass bootkit filters and read/write directly to disk. The document concludes with an overview of how this technique can be demonstrated against the TDL4 bootkit.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1icbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1icbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdjcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdjcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The document introduces CrowdStrike speakers George Kurtz, Georg Wicherski, and Alex Radocea. It then discusses the evolution of threats from commercial remote access tools (RATs) to targeted RATs and advanced threats. Examples of commercial RATs like FlexiSPY and targeted RATs like LuckyCat are analyzed. The feasibility of developing exploits and native Android RATs is also explored.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1jcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1jcbjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="moreFromUser-card-description-19" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1kcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":R1kcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1kcbjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/be-social-use-crowdre/13412246"><span class="sr-only">Be Social. Use CrowdRE.</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:19" data-testid="card-thumbnail"><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_blur__opK6A Thumbnail_cover__1zsIi" alt="Be Social. Use CrowdRE." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/recon-crowdre-final-120621174609-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/><img class="Thumbnail_thumb__UXO3a Thumbnail_contain__K6M0d" alt="Be Social. Use CrowdRE." src="https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/recon-crowdre-final-120621174609-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=560&amp;fit=bounds" loading="lazy"/></div><div class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Be Social. Use CrowdRE.</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Be Social. Use CrowdRE. for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdkcbjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdkcbjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdkcbjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdkcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdkcbjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/CrowdStrike">CrowdStrike</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">CrowdRE is an IDA Pro plugin that enables collaborative reverse engineering by allowing analysts to share and synchronize analysis results for malware samples. It uses a version control-like system to manage annotations on functions and types, and features fuzzy matching to import relevant annotations from other analysts who have worked on similar code. The tool aims to improve efficiency of malware analysis by facilitating distributed and collaborative work between reverse engineers.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1kcbjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1kcbjnf6"></div></div><div class="desktop-recs"><div class="Slider_root__c0Jo8"><div class="Slider_scroller__KHjw4"><div 📕 Agenda
Welcome &amp; Introductions
Orchestrator API Overview
Exploring the Swagger Interface
Test Manager API Highlights
Streamlining Automation &amp; Testing with APIs (Demo)
Q&amp;A and Open Discussion
Perfect for developers, testers, and automation enthusiasts!

👉 Join our UiPath Community Berlin chapter: https://community.uipath.com/berlin/
This session streamed live on April 29, 2025, 18:00 CET.

Metropolitan University, 29th April 2...</span></a><div class="slideshow-thumbnail Thumbnail_root__qLW0K SlideshowCard_thumb__86aJk" style="aspect-ratio:1.5;--index:6" class="SlideshowCard_content__xh7kV slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">AI Changes Everything – Talk at Cardiff Metropolitan University, 29th April 2...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save AI Changes Everything – Talk at Cardiff Metropolitan University, 29th April 2... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbd7ccjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbd7ccjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbd7ccjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbd7ccjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbd7ccjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/alanjohndix">Alan Dix</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Talk at the final event of Data Fusion Dynamics: A Collaborative UK-Saudi Initiative in Cybersecurity and Artificial Intelligence funded by the British Council UK-Saudi Challenge Fund 2024, Cardiff Metropolitan University, 29th April 2025

https://alandix.com/academic/talks/CMet2025-AI-Changes-Everything/

Is AI just another technology, or does it fundamentally change the way we live and think?

Every technology has a direct impact with micro-ethical consequences, some good, some bad. However more profound are the ways in which some technologies reshape the very fabric of society with macro-ethical impacts. The invention of the stirrup revolutionised mounted combat, but as a side effect gave rise to the feudal system, which still shapes politics today. The internal combustion engine offers personal freedom and creates pollution, but has also transformed the nature of urban planning and international trade. When we look at AI the micro-ethical issues, such as bias, are most obvious, but the macro-ethical challenges may be greater.

At a micro-ethical level AI has the potential to deepen social, ethnic and gender bias, issues I have warned about since the early 1990s! It is also being used increasingly on the battlefield. However, it also offers amazing opportunities in health and educations, as the recent Nobel prizes for the developers of AlphaFold illustrate. More radically, the need to encode ethics acts as a mirror to surface essential ethical problems and conflicts.

At the macro-ethical level, by the early 2000s digital technology had already begun to undermine sovereignty (e.g. gambling), market economics (through network effects and emergent monopolies), and the very meaning of money. Modern AI is the child of big data, big computation and ultimately big business, intensifying the inherent tendency of digital technology to concentrate power. AI is already unravelling the fundamentals of the social, political and economic world around us, but this is a world that needs radical reimagining to overcome the global environmental and human challenges that confront us. Our challenge is whether to let the threads fall as they may, or to use them to weave a better future.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R17ccjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R17ccjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/UiPathCommunity">UiPathCommunity</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">This session is designed to equip developers with the skills needed to build mission-critical, end-to-end processes that seamlessly orchestrate agents, people, and robots.

📕 Here&#x27;s what you can expect:
- Modeling: Build end-to-end processes using BPMN.
- Implementing: Integrate agentic tasks, RPA, APIs, and advanced decisioning into processes.
- Operating: Control process instances with rewind, replay, pause, and stop functions.
- Monitoring: Use dashboards and embedded analytics for real-time insights into process instances.
This webinar is a must-attend for developers looking to enhance their agentic automation skills and orchestrate robust, mission-critical processes. 

👨‍🏫 Speaker:
Andrei Vintila, Principal Product Manager  @UiPath  

This session streamed live on April 29, 2025, 16:00 CET.

Level Up Your Accessibility Game_ A11y Audit, WCAG, and... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdcccjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdcccjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdcccjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdcccjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdcccjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/JuliaUndeutsch">Julia Undeutsch</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">Are you ready to level up your accessibility knowledge? In this session, we’ll walk through my A11y audit template, learn how it’s helped me understand WCAG guidelines, and discover how you can use it to make impactful changes. I&#x27;ll take a quick detour into how A11y can help you become active in open source, and how open source can help you improve your a11y skills.

Laura Wissiak will also join the session, and together we’ll dive deep into the POUR principles (Perceivable, Operable, Understandable, Robust) and discuss how to turn audit results into meaningful, actionable tickets that improve accessibility.

With her Pokédex of accessibility you will understand why aiming for AAA accessibility standards isn’t just a goal—it’s about striving for the best, just like in video games. Why play to just pass when you can master the game? Let’s elevate our accessibility efforts together!

Focus: A11y Audit, WCAG 2.1, POUR, Ticketing, Open Source

Target audience: Everyone (Project Managers, Designers, Developers, Testers, and Pokémon Lovers)</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1cccjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" slideshow-card-content"><span class="slideshow-title SlideshowTitle_root__2VccW RailCard_title__Tvfiv ellipsis" style="-webkit-line-clamp:2" data-cy="slideshow-title">Most Inspirational Business Leaders Driving Innovation in 2025</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save Most Inspirational Business Leaders Driving Innovation in 2025 for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdgccjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdgccjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdgccjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdgccjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdgccjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/timeiconic007">timeiconic007</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The mobility and telematics industry has become a cornerstone of innovation, reshaping how businesses manage fleets, optimize logistics, and leverage real-time data. A single connected vehicle can now transmit detailed insights about performance, safety, and location—turning transportation into a strategic advantage.

Darius Marcu, Business Enabler at CANGO Mobility, stands out as a driving force behind these advancements. He is a dynamic professional whose career has been deeply intertwined with the evolution of the telematics and fleet management industry. A Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu practitioner, avid hiker, and passionate reader, Darius brings an array of personal interests into his role at CANGO Mobility. For over three years, he has been pivotal in the business development sector of the company, engaging with technical leaders across the globe to help enhance the capabilities of telematics manufacturers and fleet management platform providers.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1gccjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" style="position-anchor:--popover-R1gccjnf6"></div><div class="separator Separator_root__70Ime Separator_horizontal__czVEa" style="--color:var(--blue-gray-200);--size:1px" role="separator"></div><div class="RailCard_root__rZUGY RailCard_hasDescription__MjSgf SlideshowCard_root__pD8t4 slideshow-card" aria-describedby="latest-card-description-16" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":R1hccjnf6:" popovertarget=":R1hccjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-R1hccjnf6"><a class="SlideshowCardLink_root__p8KI7" data-cy="slideshow-card-link" data-testid="slideshow-card-link" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/what-is-model-context-protocol-mcp-the-new-technology-for-communication-bw-apps-and-softwares/278525340"><span class="sr-only">What is Model Context Protocol(MCP) - The new technology for communication bw...</span><button type="button" class="Button_root__i1yp0 Button_secondary__hHiHI Button_text__ZT_3O Button_small__sqsEx Button_icon__1C4qi save-slideshow-button SaveButton_root__b6zuu" data-testid="button" aria-checked="false" aria-label="Save What is Model Context Protocol(MCP) - The new technology for communication bw... for later" role="switch" aria-haspopup="dialog" aria-controls=":Rbdhccjnf6:" popovertarget=":Rbdhccjnf6:" style="anchor-name:--popover-Rbdhccjnf6"><span class="icon Icon_root__AjZyv" style="--size:24px"><span class="Icon_icon__4zzsG" style="mask-image:url(https://public.slidesharecdn.com/_next/static/media/save.ef1812e2.svg);background-color:currentColor"></span><span class="sr-only"></span></span></button><div class="Tooltip_root__7FS0Y" id=":Rbdhccjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="top" style="position-anchor:--popover-Rbdhccjnf6"></div><a class="SlideshowAuthor_root__IkT1_ RailCard_author__JYeYZ slideshow-author ellipsis" data-testid="slideshow-author" data-cy="slideshow-author" href="https://www.slideshare.net/VishnuSinghChundawat">Vishnu Singh Chundawat</a><div class="slideshow-stats SlideshowStats_root__EQOR1 RailCard_stats__ZvZms"> </div><span aria-hidden="true" class="seo-only">The MCP (Model Context Protocol) is a framework designed to manage context and interaction within complex systems. This SlideShare presentation will provide a detailed overview of the MCP Model, its applications, and how it plays a crucial role in improving communication and decision-making in distributed systems. We will explore the key concepts behind the protocol, including the importance of context, data management, and how this model enhances system adaptability and responsiveness. Ideal for software developers, system architects, and IT professionals, this presentation will offer valuable insights into how the MCP Model can streamline workflows, improve efficiency, and create more intuitive systems for a wide range of use cases.</span></div></div><div class="" id=":R1hccjnf6:" popover="auto" data-popover-position="bottom-start" class="sr-only"></span></span>CrowdCasts Monthly: You Have an Adversary Problem</h2><div><ul class="Transcript_list__faItj"><div><li>1. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" ADVERSARY </a> PROBLEM.
Who’s Targeting You and Why?

 </li></div><div><li>2. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#2">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

AGENDA

YOU </a> HAVE AN ADVERSARY PROBLEM.

 </li></div><div><li>3. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#3">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Today’s </a> Speakers
ADAM MEYERS |
VP, INTELLIGENCE
Recognized speaker, trainer, and intelligence expert with 15+ years
of cyber security industry experience
10 years in the DIB supporting US GOV customers on topics
ranging from wireless, pen testing, IR, and malware analysis

@ADAM_CYBER

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

3

 </li></div><div><li>4. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#4">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Today’s </a> Speakers
MATT DAHL |
SENIOR ANALYST/ LEGAL COUNSEL
Cyber threat analyst focused on targeted intrusion activity
Focused on investigating indicators of compromise to identify
specific adversary activity
Legal liaison to the CrowdStrike Intelligence Team

@CROWDSTRIKE

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

4

 </li></div><div><li>5. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#5">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversaries </a> are humans
Targeted Attackers:

WHO ARE THE
ADVERSARIES?

Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
They need to get in
They will likely need to move laterally

Spray and Pray (Prey):
They don’t care who they target
(sometimes what)
The more they compromise the
more they win
Motivation can range from disruption,
theft, to even destruction
2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

5

 </li></div><div><li>6. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#6">INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN SECURITY

2013 CrowdStrike, </a> Inc. All rights reserved.
