 </li></div><div><li>7. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#7">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Adversary </a> Categorization
CATEGORIZATION| Adversary Groups

1

Tactics, Techniques, and Practices

2

Never assume relationships exist
Between indicators

3

Recognize adversaries are constantly changing

4

But RECOGNIZE they are HUMAN

CATEGORIZATION

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

Aerospace, Government
Delivery: Likely spearphishing

STONE PANDA?

IEChecker

menuPass, happyyongzi, Thankss,
Xgstone, keaidestone, and admin

u1.FartIT.com; jj.mysecondarydns.com;

114.80.96.8

 </li></div><div><li>20. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#20">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Timeline: </a> CORSAIR JACKAL

2012 XTnR3v0LT
colludes with Anonymous
group XL3gi0n

January 25, 2013 New
members added

January 22, 2013
XTnR3v0LT announce
formation of TCA

March 1 2013 Announced
compromise of US financial

February 2013
Announced
participation in
#opblacksummer

July 29 2013 Ben Khlifa
announces new personal page

May 7, 2013
XTnR3v0LT
arrested by Tunisian
Authorities

September 2, 2013
Tweets XSS
vulnerability on
Sourceforge

2013 CrowdStrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

20

 </li></div><div><li>21. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#21">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

Target </a> Sectors: Energy; Financial;
Government; Shipping;
Telecommunications

WHO IS
CORSAIR
JACKAL?

Primarily One Individual: Fahmi Ben
Khlifa (XTnR3v0LT)
Professed nationalistic motivations for
malicious activity, but also white hat
activity.
Cross-site scripting attacks used to
compromise databases at target
organizations.

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

 </li></div><div><li>30. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#30">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN </a> SECURITY
INTELLIGENCE| Adversary-Centric

1

INTELLIGENCE

Understand the adversaries targeting your
Vertical | Company | Geo-Location | Customers

2

Build appropriate defenses to counter/detect
these adversaries

3

Perform other security practices from an
Adversary-centric perspective
Pen Testing (Red Team)
Security Operations Brieﬁngs
Log Review

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

30

 </li></div><div><li>31. <a class="Transcript_link__MLbGS" href="https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/crowd-casts-monthly-you-have-an-adversary-problem/27262315#31">@CROWDSTRIKE | #CROWDCASTS

INTELLIGENCE-DRIVEN </a> SECURITY
INTELLIGENCE| Making it Actionable

1
ACTIONALIZING INTELLIGENCE

Intelligence is diﬃcult to consume
Lots of information to keep straight
New data constantly ﬂowing in (possibly unvetted)

2

Security Operations need to change shis &amp; people

3

Actionable Intelligence

Pass down can’t possibly occur with all indicators

2013 Crowdstrike, Inc. All rights reserved.

      try {
        window.eventsToSend = window.eventsToSend || []
        if (window.Osano) {
          window.eventsToSend.push({
            name: "osano_loaded",
            timestamp: new Date().toISOString(),
            value: JSON.stringify({
              time: performance?.now()
            })
          })
        }
      } catch (error) {
        console.error("Failed to push Osano event:", error)

Who's Targeting You and Why? \r\n \r\nNation-States, Hacktivists, Industrial Spies, and Organized Criminal Groups are attacking your enterprise on a daily basis. Their goals range from espionage for technology advancement and disruption of critical infrastructure to for-profit theft of trade secrets and supporting a political agenda. You no longer have a malware problem, you have an adversary problem, and you must incorporate an intelligence-driven approach to your security strategy. \r\n \r\nDuring this CrowdCast, you will learn how to:\r\n\r\n    Incorporate Actionable Intelligence into your existing enterprise security infrastructure \r\n    Quickly understand the capabilities and artifacts of targeted attacked tradecraft \r\n    Gain insight into the motivations and intentions of targeted attackers\r\n    Make informed decisions based off of specific threat Collaborative defense has become critical to IT security, and sharing threat intelligence is a force multiplier. But for many organizations, good quality intelligence is hard to come by.\r\n\r\nCommercial threat intelligence technology and services can help enterprises arm themselves with the strategic, tactical and operational insights they need to identify and respond to global threat activity, and integrate intelligence into their security programs.\r\n\r\nThreat intelligence sources have varying levels of relevance and context, and there are concerns about data quality and redundancy, shelf life, public/private data sharing, and threat intelligence standards. However, if processed and applied properly, threat intelligence provides a way for organizations to get the insight they need into attackers’ plans, prioritize and respond to threats, shorten the time between attack and detection, and focus staff efforts and decision-making.\r\n\r\nView to learn: \r\n\r\n--The difference between threat information and threat intelligence.\r\n--Available sources of intelligence and how to determine if they apply to your business.\r\n--Key steps for preparing to ingest threat information and turn it into intelligence.\r\n--How to derive useful data that helps you achieve your business goals.\r\n--Tools that are available to make collaboration easier.","tags":["threat","information security","data security"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/6-steps-for-operationalizing-threat-intelligence/63848095","userLogin":"Forsythe_Technology","userName":"Sirius","viewCount":2841},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"The Cyber Threat Intelligence Matrix","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":40,"score":0.593334,"slideshowId":"67745151","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"the-cyber-threat-intelligence-matrix","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/2016-10274sicsthe-cyber-threat-intelligence-matrixfrode-hommedaltelenor-161027190146-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"As we get to know what life in the digital domain is like, one of the revelations we've had is that many large and plenty of smaller organisations are targets of espionage, of the nefarious APT.\r\n\r\nDuring the last decade, it has become gospel to wait, watch, analyse and learn if you detect such an attacker in your infrastructure. However, there's room for locally grown threat actors operating in the cyber espionage field as well. During the last decade, this includes but is not limited to Blind Eagle, Puppeteer, Machete, Poseidon, and others. We also saw foreign operations targeting specific assets in Latin America, still connected to certain regional sources.\n\nSince the threat actors' origin, culture, and language is often different, it's not uncommon for tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTPs) to present marked differences. As a result of our regional expertise and experience, we created MITRE's ATT\u0026CK play-by-play mappings to help other analysts understand regional actors. In a short period of time, WannaCry (also known as Wanna Decryptor and WannaCryptor) infected over 230,000 systems in 150 countries. It was a particularly effective piece of malware because it not only encrypted data and held it for ransom, but it also spread like wildfire to other systems. Entire organizations found themselves looking at a ransom note on their screens and wondering what to do next.\r\n\r\nAs the situation continues to unfold, please join us as Adam Myers, VP of Threat Intelligence at CrowdStrike, presents an in-depth look at the WannaCry ransomware.\r\n\r\nRegister for this webcast to learn:\r\n-A complete technical understanding of the WannaCry threat\r\n-What analysts were seeing on the day of the WannaCry outbreak\r\n-How to prevent WannaCry infections and protect against ransomware going forward","tags":["next-gen endpoint protection","wannacry","information security"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/an-inside-look-at-the-wannacry-ransomware-outbreak/76270074","userLogin":"CrowdStrike","userName":"CrowdStrike","viewCount":1825},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"Using ATTACK to Create Cyber DBTS for Nuclear Power Plants","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":15,"score":0.579885,"slideshowId":"241296785","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"using-attack-to-create-cyber-dbts-for-nuclear-power-plants","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/attckcon-final1-210113202045-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"From MITRE ATT\u0026CKcon Power Hour December 2020\r\n\r\nBy Jacob Benjamin, Principal Industrial Consultant Dragos, INL, \u0026 University of Idaho \r\n\r\nDesign Basis Threat (DBT) is concept introduced by the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC). It is a profile of the type, composition, and capabilities of an adversary. DBT is the key input nuclear power plants use for the design of systems against acts of radiological sabotage and theft of special nuclear material. The NRC expects its licensees, nuclear power plants, to demonstrate that they can defend against the DBT. Currently, cyber is included in DBTs simply as a prescribed list of IT centric security controls. Using MITRE’s ATT\u0026CK framework, Cyber DBTs can be created that are specific to the facility, its material, or adversary activities.","tags":["mitre att\u0026ck","mitre attackcon power hour","mitre attack"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/using-attack-to-create-cyber-dbts-for-nuclear-power-plants/241296785","userLogin":"attackcon2018","userName":"MITRE - ATT\u0026CKcon","viewCount":592},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"Cyber Threat Intelligence","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":8,"score":0.577724,"slideshowId":"225070562","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"cyber-threat-intelligence-225070562","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/cyberti-200127133007-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"Cyber threat intelligence involves collecting, analyzing, and sharing information about threats to help organizations assess risks and defend themselves. It follows principles like being centralized, objective, and continuous. The Structured Threat Information Expression (STIX) framework allows sharing threat data consistently between organizations using common language. Intrusion detection systems monitor networks and systems for malicious activity, using either signature-based methods to detect known threats or anomaly-based methods to find unknown behaviors.","tags":["#cybersecurity","#cyberthreatintelligence","#stix"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/cyber-threat-intelligence-225070562/225070562","userLogin":"ZaiffiEhsan","userName":"ZaiffiEhsan","viewCount":496},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"Cloud-Enabled: The Future of Endpoint Security","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":36,"score":0.577722,"slideshowId":"72428833","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"cloudenabled-the-future-of-endpoint-security","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/futureofendpointsecuritycc-170221194042-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"As the cost and complexity of deploying and maintaining on-premises security continues to rise, many endpoint security providers have embraced the cloud as the ideal way to deliver their solutions. Yet, incorporating cloud services into legacy architectures limits their ability to fully engage the tremendous power the cloud offers.\r\n\r\nCrowdStrike Falcon recognized the value of cloud-delivery from the beginning, developing architecture built from the ground up to take full advantage of the cloud. CrowdStrike’s cloud-powered endpoint security not only ensures rapid deployment and infinite scalability, it increases your security posture by enabling real-time advanced threat protection across even the largest, distributed enterprises.\r\n\r\nIn this CrowdCast, Jackie Castelli, Sr. Product Manager will discuss:\r\n\r\n•The advantages of endpoint protection purpose-built for the cloud – why it allows you to take full advantage of the cloud’s power\r\n•The common concerns organizations face when evaluating cloud-based endpoint security - can privacy and control be assured?\r\n•Real-world examples demonstrating the unique advantages    offered by CrowdStrike Falcon’s innovative cloud-powered platform","tags":["endpoint protection","next-gen endpoint protection","cyber security"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/cloudenabled-the-future-of-endpoint-security/72428833","userLogin":"CrowdStrike","userName":"CrowdStrike","viewCount":3132},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"Threat hunting 101 by Sandeep Singh","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":18,"score":0.576931,"slideshowId":"142516311","sourceName":"cm_interact","strippedTitle":"threat-hunting-101-by-sandeep-singh","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/threathunting101-190427151258-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"Getting Started with Threat Hunting (Threat Hunting 101) by Sandeep Singh at the combined null Delhi and OWASP Delhi December meet up","tags":["threat hunting","threat intelligence","information security"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/threat-hunting-101-by-sandeep-singh/142516311","userLogin":"OWASPdelhi","userName":"OWASP Delhi","viewCount":1662},{"algorithmId":"5","displayTitle":"Grow Up! Key points include:\n\n- The malware uses inline code obfuscation and encrypted strings to hide its functionality and communication domains. Researchers were able to deobfuscate the code and decrypt the strings to analyze the malware. \n\n- Clues in decrypted strings suggest the malware author is Romani, including references to Romani singers in template strings. \n\n- The malware generates domain names by concatenating two randomly selected words from a dictionary and appending \".net\". This allows it to generate many domain variations to communicate with its command and control servers.\n\n- The DGA algorithm uses a 15-bit seed value derived from the","tags":["crowdstrike","cyber","black hat"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/endtoend-analysis-of-a-domain-generating/25244628","userLogin":"CrowdStrike","userName":"CrowdStrike","viewCount":9359},{"algorithmId":"","displayTitle":"TOR... ALL THE THINGS","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":32,"score":0,"slideshowId":"25244568","sourceName":"MORE_FROM_USER","strippedTitle":"tor-all-the-things","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/tor-130814102922-phpapp02-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"The global Tor network and its routing protocols provide an excellent framework for online anonymity. However, the selection of Tor-friendly software for Windows is sub-par at best. \r\n\r\nWant to anonymously browse the web? You’re stuck with Firefox, and don’t even think about trying to anonymously use Flash. Want to dynamically analyze malware without letting the C2 server know your home IP address? You’re outta luck. Want to anonymously use any program that doesn’t natively support SOCKS or HTTP proxying? Not gonna happen. \r\n\r\nWhile some solutions currently exist for generically rerouting traffic through Tor, these solutions either don’t support Windows, or can be circumvented by malware, or require an additional network gateway device. \r\n\r\nMissed the live session at Black Hat USA 2013? Check out the slides from Jason Geffner's standing room only presentation! Jason released a free new CrowdStrike community tool to securely, anonymously, and transparently route all TCP/IP and DNS traffic through Tor, regardless of the client software, and without relying on VPNs or additional hardware or virtual machines.","tags":["crowdstrike","tor","tcp/ip"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/tor-all-the-things/25244568","userLogin":"CrowdStrike","userName":"CrowdStrike","viewCount":8144},{"algorithmId":"","displayTitle":"End-to-End Analysis of a Domain Generating Algorithm Malware Family Whitepaper","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":41,"score":0,"slideshowId":"25207649","sourceName":"MORE_FROM_USER","strippedTitle":"end-toend-analysis-of-a-domain-generating-algorithm-malware-family-whitepaper","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/end-to-end-20analysis-20of-20a-20domain-20generating-20algorithm-20malware-20family-20-20whitepaper-130813094833-phpapp01-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"The document provides an overview of domain generating algorithms (DGAs) used by malware to dynamically determine remote server addresses and evade detection. Changes Everything – Talk at Cardiff Metropolitan University, 29th April 2...","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":41,"score":0,"slideshowId":"278570084","sourceName":"LATEST","strippedTitle":"ai-changes-everything-talk-at-cardiff-metropolitan-university-29th-april-2025","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/cmet-2025-ai-changes-everything-upload-250429172231-0162ebd4-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"Talk at the final event of Data Fusion Dynamics: A Collaborative UK-Saudi Initiative in Cybersecurity and Artificial Intelligence funded by the British Council UK-Saudi Challenge Fund 2024, Cardiff Metropolitan University, 29th April 2025\n\nhttps://alandix.com/academic/talks/CMet2025-AI-Changes-Everything/\n\nIs AI just another technology, or does it fundamentally change the way we live and think?\n\nEvery technology has a direct impact with micro-ethical consequences, some good, some bad. However more profound are the ways in which some technologies reshape the very fabric of society with macro-ethical impacts. The invention of the stirrup revolutionised mounted combat, but as a side effect gave rise to the feudal system, which still shapes politics today. The internal combustion engine offers personal freedom and creates pollution, but has also transformed the nature of urban planning and international trade. When we look at AI the micro-ethical issues, such as bias, are most obvious, but the macro-ethical challenges may be greater.\n\nAt a micro-ethical level AI has the potential to deepen social, ethnic and gender bias, issues I have warned about since the early 1990s! It is also being used increasingly on the battlefield. However, it also offers amazing opportunities in health and educations, as the recent Nobel prizes for the developers of AlphaFold illustrate. More radically, the need to encode ethics acts as a mirror to surface essential ethical problems and conflicts.\n\nAt the macro-ethical level, by the early 2000s digital technology had already begun to undermine sovereignty (e.g. gambling), market economics (through network effects and emergent monopolies), and the very meaning of money. Modern AI is the child of big data, big computation and ultimately big business, intensifying the inherent tendency of digital technology to concentrate power. AI is already unravelling the fundamentals of the social, political and economic world around us, but this is a world that needs radical reimagining to overcome the global environmental and human challenges that confront us. Our challenge is whether to let the threads fall as they may, or to use them to weave a better future.","tags":["artificial intelligence","machine learning","ethics"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/ai-changes-everything-talk-at-cardiff-metropolitan-university-29th-april-2025/278570084","userLogin":"alanjohndix","userName":"Alan Dix","viewCount":86},{"algorithmId":"4","displayTitle":"AI in Web Development – A Complete Guide.pdf","isSavedByCurrentUser":false,"pageCount":15,"score":0,"slideshowId":"278360906","sourceName":"LATEST","strippedTitle":"ai-in-web-development-a-complete-guide-pdf","thumbnail":"https://cdn.slidesharecdn.com/ss_thumbnails/aiinwebdevelopmentacompleteguide-250424085640-9408c1a1-thumbnail.jpg?width=600\u0026height=600\u0026fit=bounds","description":"Build intelligent digital solutions with ease. This SlideShare presentation will provide a detailed overview of the MCP Model, its applications, and how it plays a crucial role in improving communication and decision-making in distributed systems. We will explore the key concepts behind the protocol, including the importance of context, data management, and how this model enhances system adaptability and responsiveness. Ideal for software developers, system architects, and IT professionals, this presentation will offer valuable insights into how the MCP Model can streamline workflows, improve efficiency, and create more intuitive systems for a wide range of use cases.","tags":["mcp","training","machine learning"],"url":"https://www.slideshare.net/slideshow/what-is-model-context-protocol-mcp-the-new-technology-for-communication-bw-apps-and-softwares/278525340","userLogin":"VishnuSinghChundawat","userName":"Vishnu Singh Chundawat","viewCount":21},{"algorithmId":"4","displayTitle":"Webinar recap Odoo 101 -
